com.yantra.yfc.rcp.internal

Class YRCActivityEventManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.internal.YRCActivityEventManager

  • public class YRCActivityEventManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Main class that provides static utilities for raising activity events on the server side within Sterling Rich Client Platform applications.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • YRCActivityEventManager

        public YRCActivityEventManager()

    • Method Detail

      • isActivityTrackingEnabled

        public static boolean isActivityTrackingEnabled()
        Returns:
        True if analytic event collection is enabled.

      • setActivityTrackingEnabled

        public static void setActivityTrackingEnabled(boolean isActivityTrackingEnabled)
        Parameters:
        isActivityTrackingEnabled - True to enable analytic event collection, False to disable event collection.

      • raiseEvent

        public static void raiseEvent(YRCActivityEvent event)
        Utility method to raise a analytics event.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to be raised

      • isForcePublish

        public static boolean isForcePublish()
        Returns:
        True if events need to be published immediately, typical use case is during logout.

      • setForcePublish

        public static void setForcePublish(boolean forcePublish)
        Parameters:
        forcePublish - True if events need to be published immediately, typical use case is during logout.

      • getLastPublished

        public static long getLastPublished()
        Returns:
        The last time events were published.

      • getMaxTimeToWaitBeforePublish

        public static int getMaxTimeToWaitBeforePublish()
        Returns:
        The maximum amount of time to wait before events are published event if the getMaxEventsToBufferHint() is not reached.

      • getMaxEventsToBufferHint

        public static int getMaxEventsToBufferHint()
        Returns:
        The maximum number of events to buffer before sending them to the server.

      • handleLogout

        public static void handleLogout()
        Utility method to handle user logout scenario. The buffered events are force published in this case.
